title: Which Areas of Split Are Best for Families with Kids?
h1: Best Family-Friendly Areas in Split, Croatia
summary: For families with young children, Spinut and Firule are the top neighborhoods in Split. Both offer quiet residential streets, proximity to beaches with shallow waters, playgrounds, and essential amenities within walking distance.
bestForFamilies: Spinut - Quiet residential area with a sandy beach (Bene), only 10 minutes from the Old Town. Plenty of playgrounds and family-run restaurants.
Firule - Safe neighborhood with a small pebble beach and shallow water, ideal for toddlers. Local market and bakeries nearby.
Meje - Close to Marjan Forest Park for hiking and cycling. Peaceful atmosphere with minimal nightlife.
Žnjan - Further from the center but has the longest beaches. Modern area with supermarkets and cafes.
avoid: Bačvice - Famous party beach with loud music until late. Not suitable for families seeking quiet nights.
Old Town (Diocletian's Palace) - Charming but very crowded, narrow streets difficult with strollers, and noisy at night.
Split 3 district - Industrial area, farther from beaches and attractions.
practicalNotes: Spinut and Firule are 15-20 minutes walk from the Old Town, or a short bus ride (lines 12, 17).
Most family restaurants close around 22:00, perfect for early bedtimes.
Beaches in Spinut (Bene) have changing facilities and showers.
Local markets in Firule open daily 7:00-14:00 for fresh produce.

qa.q: Is Spinut safe for kids at night?
qa.a: Yes, Spinut is one of the safest neighborhoods in Split. It's primarily residential with well-lit streets and minimal late-night activity.

qa.q: Can we walk from Firule to the Old Town with a stroller?
qa.a: Yes, the route is flat and takes about 20 minutes along the Riva promenade. Alternatively, buses 12 and 17 are stroller-friendly.

qa.q: Are there playgrounds near these areas?
qa.a: Both Spinut and Firule have multiple playgrounds. The largest is in Marjan Park, accessible from both neighborhoods.
